html.div: Splunk collects machine data from any source in any format across the enterprise. Machine data contains a definitive record of all activity and behavior of your users, citizens, transactions, applications, servers, networks, mobile devices, sensors and more. It includes configurations, data from APIs, message queues, call detail records and sensor data. These key capabilities of Splunk help promote and ease the adoption of a Risk Management Framework.

div.span: Splunk Enterprise, Splunk Enterprise Security, Splunk User Behavior Analytics

div.p:
Attribute risk to users and systems, map alerts to cybersecurity frameworks, and trigger alerts when risk exceeds thresholds.
Categorize information systems and information processed, stored and transmitted by systems based on an impact analysis.
Select an initial set of baseline security controls for information systems based on the security categorization.
Implement security controls and document how they are deployed within information systems and operating environments.
Assess security controls to determine the extent that they are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing desired outcomes with respect to meeting security requirements.
Authorize information systems operation based on risk and the decision that this risk is acceptable.
Monitor and assess security controls on an ongoing basis including control effectiveness, documenting changes, conducting impact analyses of changes and reporting security state to appropriate organizational officials.
